data.title: Green Beret Foundation on LinkedIn: #podcast #greenberet #golftournament #author #fundraisingevent #military
data.meta_description: Episode: 347 on Jocko Willink Podcast features Nick Lavery an active-duty Green Beret who sustained injuries in combat resulting in an above-the-knee…
data.text:
America’s next fight will require forces capable of operating in the extended deep—the denied area of an adversary that only a highly specialized force can penetrate. These are Green Beret Problems. Major General Gil Ferguson, Commanding General of 1st Special Forces Command, joined Fran Racioppi for a conversation on the culture of the Regiment, how the Special Forces Groups are preparing for regional conflicts with unknown enemies at unknown times, and how Green Berets are solidifying themselves as the go-to option in the deep sensor fight against our peer adversaries. General Ferguson also explains the SOF-Space-Cyber Triad, where he sees Special Forces in a decade, and what needs to stay the same as our units evolve. Episode 142 is live! Listen, Watch, or Read: https://lnkd.in/gcBhjdjv The opinions presented on The Jedburgh Podcast and the Jedburgh Media Channel are the opinions of the guests and the host. They do not reflect the opinions of the Green Beret Foundation and the Green Beret Foundation assumes no liability for their accuracy. #SpecialForces #GreenBerets #USArmy #SpecialOperations #MilitaryCulture #SpecialForcesGroups #RegionalConflicts #PeerAdversaries #DeepSensorFight #SOF #SOFSpaceCyber #MilitaryStrategy

Lethality, audacity, and creativity. That’s the culture of the Special Forces Regiment and the values each Special Operator is expected to live by. They’re also the foundation of what it takes to be the premier partnered irregular warfare force in the arsenal of the United States Military. Fran Racioppi is joined by Major General Gil Ferguson, Commanding General of 1st Special Forces Command (Airborne) - US Army, for a conversation on the culture of the Regiment, how the Special Forces Groups are preparing for regional conflicts with unknown enemies at unknown times, and how Green Berets are solidifying themselves as the go-to option in the deep sensor fight against our peer adversaries. General Ferguson also explains the SOF-Space-Cyber Triad, where he sees Special Forces in a decade, and as our units evolve, what needs to stay the same. Episode 142 is live! Listen, Watch, or Read: https://lnkd.in/gcBhjdjv The opinions presented on The Jedburgh Podcast and the Jedburgh Media Channel are the opinions of the guests and the host. They do not reflect the opinions of the Green Beret Foundation and the Green Beret Foundation assumes no liability for their accuracy. #SpecialForces #GreenBerets #USArmy #SpecialOperations #MilitaryCulture #Leadership

The Army has directed a reduction in Special Operations Forces personnel. Who’s getting cut and the interpretation of the effect it will have on the Regiment has been a divisive issue; especially at a time when global tensions are heightened. Florida Congressman and Green Beret Michael Waltz is fighting to keep the force intact. From Normandy’s Mont Saint Michel drop zone, he joined Fran Racioppi fresh from his C-47 jump and in full WWII battle uniform to discuss the world order, China, NATO, immigration, the effects of reductions in Special Forces and what to expect over the next four months in a charged US election cycle. Listen, Watch, or Read: https://lnkd.in/gcBhjdjv The opinions presented on The Jedburgh Podcast and the Jedburgh Media Channel are the opinions of the guests and the host. They do not reflect the opinions of the Green Beret Foundation and the Green Beret Foundation assumes no liability for their accuracy. #CongressmanWaltz #NATO #2024Election #ForeignPolicy #NationalSecurity #USCongress #SpecialForces

Kickstart the Stars & Stripes Classic with the 18 Series Match Challenge! A generous donor has pledged up to $30,000 to match our fundraising efforts, meaning every dollar you donate will be matched! Don’t miss this chance to witness an epic battle on the field and make a lasting difference in the lives of our brave soldiers and their families. Join us at the Stars & Stripes Classic and be part of something truly special. Your support matters – GO ARMY, BEAT NAVY! Support Now: https://lnkd.in/g-wmDQnm #MatchChallenge #GoArmyBeatNavy #PremierLacrosseLeague #GreenBeretFoundation | Premier Lacrosse League

It took a day for those who survived to make it half a mile. This is the story of Omaha Beach; the D-Day invasion point responsible for linking the American and British landing forces, as well as reinforcing the Rangers at Point-Du-Hoc. Join us for a rare opportunity as one of our leading experts in Special Operations history re-enacts the historic events of June 6, 1944, shedding light on the strategic importance of Omaha Beach in the broader Operation Overlord plan. Learn how the positioning of German machine gun bunkers cut down American units as they landed, and the valiant efforts of the Ranger Battalion as they fought uphill to clear the bunkers, move to the rally point, and then and complete their mission. Only on YouTube: https://lnkd.in/gk8xAaH7 The opinions presented on The Jedburgh Podcast and the Jedburgh Media Channel are the opinions of the guests and the host. They do not reflect the opinions of the Green Beret Foundation and the Green Beret Foundation assumes no liability for their accuracy. #OmahaBeach #DDay #USASOC #WWIIHistory #RangerBattalion #MilitaryHistory #HistoricalTour #WWII #WarHeroes #ArmyHistory #NormandyFrance #USArmy #WWIIBattles #OperationOverlord

The Green Beret Foundation is pleased to present the Service Credit Union as this year's Title Sponsor for Green Beret For A Day. "Service CU takes great pride in giving back to causes that are important to our members, especially organizations who support our nation's heroes,” said Jaime Yates, Assistant Vice President of Community Development at Service CU. “We are excited to be the presenting sponsor of Green Beret For a Day and to help the foundation carry out its mission.” - Jaime Yates, Assistant Vice President of Community Development Service Credit Union | SIG SAUER, Inc. | Sig Sauer Academy | Michael Sargent Get tickets for the 2nd Annual Green Beret for a Day: https://lnkd.in/g47-4TjV

The D-Day invasion of Omaha Beach was essential to the success of Operation Overlord. It was also one of the most devastating for the American landing force. United States Army Special Operations Command Historian Dr. Troy Sacquety takes Jedburgh Media Channel Creator and Host Fran Racioppi on an in-depth tour of the D-Day invasion at Omaha Beach in Normandy, France. Join us for a rare opportunity as one of our leading experts in Special Operations history re-enacts the historic events of June 6, 1944, shedding light on the strategic importance of Omaha Beach in the broader Operation Overlord plan. Learn how the positioning of German machine gun bunkers devastated American units as they landed, and the valiant efforts of the Ranger Battalion as they fought uphill to clear the bunkers, move to the rally point, and then reinforce Point Du-Hoc. Only on YouTube: https://lnkd.in/gk8xAaH7 #OmahaBeach #DDay #USASOC #WWIIHistory #RangerBattalion #MilitaryHistory #HistoricalTour #WWII #WarHeroes #ArmyHistory #NormandyFrance #USArmy #WWIIBattles #OperationOverlord | Jedburgh Podcast
